recipe_ingredients: 1 pound boneless mutton, cut into bite-sized pieces,   1 tablespoon olive oil,   1 onion, sliced,   2 carrots, sliced,   2 bell peppers (different colors), sliced,   1 zucchini, sliced,   1 cup broccoli florets,   1/4 cup soy sauce (ensure it's kosher),   2 tablespoons honey,   1 tablespoon cornstarch,   1 teaspoon ginger, minced,   1 clove garlic, minced,   Cooked rice, for serving
recipe_instruction:
In a bowl, mix soy sauce, honey, cornstarch, ginger, and garlic. Set aside.
Heat olive oil in a large pan or wok over medium-high heat.
Add mutton and cook until browned and cooked through. Remove from pan and set aside.
Add onion and carrots to the pan and cook for 3-4 minutes until slightly softened.
Add bell peppers, zucchini, and broccoli. Cook for another 5-7 minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Return the cooked mutton to the pan.
Pour the soy sauce mixture over the mutton and vegetables. Stir well to coat everything evenly.
Cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens.
Serve hot over cooked rice.
